oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The effects of sample temperature on the concentrations of glucose and β-OH butyrate measured by the Precision Xtra meter in plasma from periparturient dairy cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Megahed, A. A.
Hiew, M. H.
Constable, P. D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: hypoglycemia
ketosis
BHB
temperature
measurement
meter
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Early and accurate diagnosis of hypoglycemia and hyperketonemia is helpful in the diagnosis and treatment of ketosis in periparturient dairy cattle. The results of a preliminary study recently indicated that the glucose concentration [glue] and β-OH butyrate concentration [BHB] measured by the Precision Xtra meter was impacted by sample temperature when temperature <89.6° (< 32°C). The objective of this study was to fully characterize the effects of sample temperature on the accuracy of the Precision Xtra® for measuring [glue] and [BHB].
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2015; 214
